Road Lighting District No. 9 -- $50.00 Serv. Chg - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. 9 Proposition
(Service Charge Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. 9 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its governing authority, be authorized to renew and assess an annual service charge of not to exceed Fifty Dollars ($50.00) per structure or lot (an estimated $67,732.00 is reasonably anticipated to be collected for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, to persons occupying residential and non-residential structures and persons owning unoccupied structures located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District and to persons owning lots located wholly or partly within the District upon which no structure is located for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting District No. 10 -- $50.00 Serv. Chg - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. 10 Proposition
(Service Charge Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Road Lighting District No. 10 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), through its governing authority, be authorized to renew and assess an annual service charge of Fifty Dollars ($50.00) per structure or lot (an estimated $1,550.00 is reasonably anticipated to be collected for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024, to persons occupying residential and non-residential structures and persons owning unoccupied structures located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District and to persons owning lots located wholly or partly within the District upon which no structure is located for the purpose of paying utility charges for road lighting and maintaining and operating road lighting facilities and equipment within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Mandeville -- 1% S&U - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Mandeville Proposition 
(Sales Tax Rededication)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Mandeville (the "City") continue to levy a tax of 1% (the "Tax"), authorized at an election held on May 1, 1999 (an estimated $4,665,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for an additional period of 10 years from the termination of its current authorization on December 31, 2019 (through December 31, 2029), upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the City, with the net proceeds of the Tax heretofore or hereafter collected (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be rededicated and used: (i) 50% for any lawful corporate purpose of the City and (ii) 50% for constructing, acquiring, extending, improving, equipping, repairing, operating and/or maintaining sewers and sewerage disposal works, waterworks improvements, streets, drains and drainage facilities and flood protection (including the payment of salaries and acquiring of all necessary land, equipment and furnishings), and shall the City be authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds for capital improvements?

Race.SpecificTitle: Mandeville HRC Amend. Prop. #1 -- HRC Amend - CC - Public Documents
Race.SummaryText:
Mandeville Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 1
Race.FullText: Shall the Mandeville Home Rule Charter be amended in technical respects to track state election laws and the Open Meetings Law, to update the charter in accordance with contemporary local governmental practices and terminology, to provide for publication of important public documents on the Internet, to clarify supermajorities necessary for certain council actions, to eliminate obsolete language, and for similar and related purposes, as more particularly set out in Ordinance No. 14-16?

Race.SpecificTitle: Mandeville HRC Amend. Prop. #2 -- HRC Amend - CC - Council Procedures
Race.SummaryText:
Mandeville Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 2
Race.FullText: Shall the Mandeville Home Rule Charter be amended to revise certain council procedures, organization, and governance, to shift responsibility for filling vacancies in the council from the governor to the mayor in the event that the council fails to make a timely appointment, to set time restrictions on when compensation for the council may be modified, to require council members-elect to comply with the Open Meetings Law, all as more particularly set out in Ordinance No. 14-17?

Race.SpecificTitle: Mandeville HRC Amend. Prop. #3 -- HRC Amend - CC - Term Limits
Race.SummaryText:
Mandeville Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 3
Race.FullText: Shall the Mandeville Home Rule Charter be amended to extend term limits from two to three consecutive terms, but to apply the extended limits to all service on the council, regardless of whether that service is in a district or at-large council position, as more particularly set out in Ordinance  No. 14-19?

Race.SpecificTitle: Mandeville HRC Amend. Prop. #4 -- HRC Amend - CC - HR Director
Race.SummaryText:
Mandeville Home Rule Charter Amendment Propositions
Proposition No. 4
Race.FullText: Shall the Mandeville Home Rule Charter be amended to move the human resources director from the unclassified to the classified service, provide for the appointment of the human resources director by the personnel board, reduce the terms of the personnel board members from five (5) to four (4) years, establish qualifications for board appointees consistent with those for the municipal police employees civil service system, and revise related provisions of the charter as needed to comport with these changes, as more particularly set out in Ordinance No. 14-24?
